title: Sound Counter
description: An interactive MicroSim where kindergarten students count phonemes in spoken words by tapping for each sound heard, developing phoneme segmentation skills essential for reading.
creator: Claude AI
subject: Reading
Phonemic Awareness
Phoneme Segmentation
learningObjectives: Understand that words are made of individual sounds
Count the number of phonemes in spoken words
Segment CVC words into individual phonemes
prerequisites: Basic understanding that words have sounds

controls.label: Hear Word
controls.description: Speak the current word using speech synthesis

controls.label: Check
controls.description: Check if the tap count matches the phoneme count

controls.label: New Word
controls.description: Load a new random word to count

controls.label: Difficulty
controls.description: Filter words by phoneme count (2, 3, 4, or all)

assumptions: User has mouse or touchscreen input
Browser supports Web Speech API for audio
Words use standard American English pronunciation
limitations: Phoneme counts based on standard pronunciation
Some regional accents may affect phoneme perception
Abstract concept may require explicit instruction
